intro: Pombalia ipecacuanha, commonly known as the Brazilian ipecac, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with opposite, elliptical leaves. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in traditional medicine for its expectorant and antispasmodic effects.
